name: complacently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows you are very satisfied with your own abilities or situation and do not feel you need to try any harder: Do not complacently assume that all is well. He was going over his books and noting complacently that he was doing remarkably well. See
complacent
More examplesFewer examplesIt is a government that has complacently lost its way. They had complacently assumed that ill-coordinated groups of rebels could pose no significant threat to seasoned English troops.She finds herself falling in love with a complacently married investment banker.
